FuncDef:
The ssh server rekey command sets the criteria that trigger SSH server key re-negotiation.
The undo ssh server rekey command restores the default values of criteria that trigger SSH server key re-negotiation. The ssh server rekey command sets the criteria that trigger SSH server key re-negotiation. The undo ssh server rekey command restores the default values of criteria that trigger SSH server key re-negotiation. By default, key re-negotiation is triggered on the SSH server when one of the following conditions is met:
CLIs: ssh server rekey { { max-packet <max-packet> } | { time <minutes> } | { data-limit <data-limit> } }
undo ssh server rekey { { max-packet [ <max-packet> ] } | { time [ <minutes> ] } | { data-limit [ <data-limit> ] } }

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies the maximum number of packets that triggers key re-negotiation.
The value is an integer ranging from 268435456 to 2147483648.

Specifies the session duration that triggers key re-negotiation.
The value is an integer in the range of 30 to 1440, in minutes.

Specifies the maximum packet data volume that triggers key re-negotiation.
The value is an integer ranging from 100 to 10000, in MB.

Examples: [~HUAWEI] ssh server rekey data-limit 10000 max-packet 268435456 time 1440
ExtraInfo: When an SSH session meets one or more of the following criteria, the system re-negotiates a key and uses the new key to establish SSH session connections, improving system security.
